test_result_details.comment: Checks if pam_faillock authfail is hit even if pam_unix skips lines by defaulting, and also authfail deny value

child.comment: pam_faillock.so authfail deny value set in password-auth

test_result_details.comment: Check pam_faillock authfail is present after pam_unix, check pam_unix has proper control values, and authfail deny value is correct.

xccdf_org.ssgproject.content_rule_accoun.comment: Lock out account after failed login attempts

child.comment: The number of allowed failed logins should be set correctly.

test_result_details.comment: check preauth maximum failed login attempts allowed in /etc/pam.d/system-auth
check authfail maximum failed login attempts allowed in /etc/pam.d/system-auth
check authfail maximum failed login attempts allowed in /etc/pam.d/password-auth
check preauth maximum failed login attempts allowed in /etc/pam.d/password-auth

xccdf_org.ssgproject.content_rule_accoun.comment: Lock out the root account after failed login attempts

child.comment:
The root account should be configured to deny access after the number of defined
      failed attempts has been reached.
pam_faillock.so preauth silent set in system-auth

test_result_details.comment: Check pam_faillock.so preauth silent present in /etc/pam.d/system-auth

child.comment: pam_faillock.so authfail deny_root value set in system-auth

test_result_details.comment: Check maximum failed login attempts allowed in /etc/pam.d/system-auth (authfail)

child.comment: pam_faillock.so preauth silent set in password-auth

test_result_details.comment: Check pam_faillock.so preauth silent present in /etc/pam.d/password-auth
